channel.title: rust on Shohei's Spontaneous Blog
channel.description: Recent content in rust on Shohei's Spontaneous Blog

item.title: Rust Tutorial: I/O
item.description: Input/output in Rust is one of the things that confuses me, so I wanted to drop a quick tutorial on how to io in Rust. use std::io; fn main() { // To begin with, let us take an input value. print!("Type something... "); let mut input_1 = String::new(); // This will prompt a user to input something. io::stdin().read_line(&mut input_1).ok().expect("failed to read line."); println!("You typed {}.", input_1); }
